title: US targets suspected drug-terror vessel off Venezuela; six killed in strike, Trump says ‚Äî Watch
content: President Trump announced a lethal strike off the coast of Venezuela, killing six individuals on a vessel affiliated with a "Designated Terrorist Organization" allegedly involved in narcotrafficking. The strike, ordered by the Secretary of War, occurred in international waters and marks the fifth fatal operation in the Caribbean under the administration's policy of treating drug traffickers as unlawful combatants.

title: 'Phase 2 begins right now': Trump on Gaza peace deal; demands dead hostages from Hamas
content: Following a hostage swap, former President Trump urged for a "phase 2" of negotiations, stating the "job is not done" as dead hostages have not been returned. Israel announced plans to cut aid to Gaza by half, citing Hamas's alleged ceasefire violations by delaying the return of deceased hostages.

title: 'I can also play': Shami fires back at Ajit Agarkar after Australia ODIs snub
content: Mohammed Shami, India's World Cup star, joined Bengal's Ranji practice, addressing his white-ball series exclusion. He dismissed fitness concerns, stating his presence for Bengal proves his readiness for longer formats. Shami emphasized that selection decisions lie with the selectors, not him, and he awaits updates from the NCA.

title: Four-time Grammy winner D‚ÄôAngelo dies at 51 after battling cancer
content: R&B icon D'Angelo, born Michael Eugene Archer, has died at 51 after a battle with cancer. A pioneer of neo-soul, he released three Grammy-winning albums, including "Brown Sugar" and "Voodoo." His career was marked by innovative music and a memorable performance in the "Untitled (How Does It Feel)" video.

title: Goldman Sachs' CIO shares these AI tips for employees: Your ability to‚Ä¶
content: Goldman Sachs CIO Marco Argenti advises professionals to thrive in AI-driven workplaces by focusing on collaboration and questioning. He outlines four strategies, emphasizing managing hybrid human-AI teams, leveraging curiosity for new insights, curating a personalized toolkit of AI models, and critically evaluating AI outputs with domain expertise.

title: List of American and Canadian technology companies banned by China
content: China has officially placed several prominent US tech firms, Canadian research outfit TechInsights, and other foreign entities on its Unreliable Entity List. Citing national security and development interests, Beijing has imposed severe trade, investment, and transaction bans on these blacklisted companies, effectively cutting them off from Chinese markets and data flows.

title: Pakistan‚Äôs 'sharm' offensive: Will again nominate Trump for Nobel
content: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif renewed his country's nomination of Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, praising his intervention in the India-Pakistan conflict. Trump, visibly pleased, joked about returning home after the praise. The event also saw some diplomatic gaffes and criticism of Trump's focus on self-praise.

title: Chips to ships: China just weaponized the sea - Xi ups ante against Trump
content: China has imposed sanctions on US subsidiaries of South Korean shipbuilding giant Hanwha Ocean, escalating the trade war. This move, alongside US port fees on Chinese ships, signals a broader fight over maritime dominance. Both nations are leveraging their shipbuilding capabilities and port access as new fronts in the ongoing economic conflict.

title: BJP‚Äôs Bihar bet: Fresh faces, caste math, old challenges - decoding 1st candidate list
content: Facing anti-incumbency, the BJP has replaced several sitting MLAs in Bihar, fielding 71 candidates for the upcoming polls. The party's first list prioritizes a mix of fresh faces and experienced leaders, balancing social justice with strategic political considerations across various caste groups. Prominent figures and new contenders feature in this crucial selection.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor‚Äôs WhatsApp plea; suggests using Zoho‚Äôs Arattai
content: India's Supreme Court has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right. The court dismissed a doctor's plea to restore her blocked account, emphasizing users must adhere to platform policies. It suggested alternatives like Zoho's Arattai app, which has seen a surge in popularity.

title: Cops rule out gang-rape in Durgapur medical student assault case; arrest victim's friend
content: West Bengal police have ruled out gang-rape in the Durgapur medical student assault case, stating one of the five arrested accused committed sexual assault. The involvement of others is under investigation, with the victim's friend also being questioned. Evidence collection, including scene reconstruction and forensic analysis, is ongoing.

title: IND vs AUS: Hitman mania! Rohit Sharma arrives in Delhi, fans flock for selfies
content: Cricket star Rohit Sharma has arrived in Delhi for India's upcoming ODI series against Australia. This marks his return to international cricket after a significant physical transformation. Sharma underwent intensive training sessions, showcasing his batting prowess. The series begins on October 19 in Perth. Fans eagerly await his comeback in the blue jersey.

title: US jobs concern: Powell sees rising unemployment risks; Fed may cut rates twice more this year
content: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell indicated potential further interest rate cuts this year due to a slowing US job market, suggesting two more reductions are possible. He acknowledged concerns about employment risks outweighing inflation, and hinted at an end to the Fed's balance sheet reduction. Powell also defended past pandemic-era asset purchases, admitting they could have concluded sooner.

title: Did Mahomes boycott Bad Bunny for Charlie Kirk? Truth explained
content: Viral claims that Patrick Mahomes would boycott the 2026 Super Bowl over Bad Bunny's halftime show and join Turning Point USA are false. Mahomes has made no such statements regarding Bad Bunny or the political group. His wife, Brittany, made a general comment about hate after Charlie Kirk's death, but Mahomes himself remains apolitical.

title: Rebecca J fires back at Offset with claim about Stefon Diggs, Cardi B
content: Rapper Offset faced backlash after implying Instagram model Rebecca J pursued him. Rebecca J responded strongly, calling Offset's actions embarrassing and defending Cardi B. She praised Cardi as self-made and referenced NFL player Stefon Diggs in a viral comment. The internet reacted to Rebecca J's defense and sharp retort, highlighting her confidence and willingness to respond.

title: Jack Roslovic reportedly lost nearly $10M before signing with Oilers
content: Jack Roslovic rejected a significant three-year offer from the Edmonton Oilers. He sought a more lucrative deal elsewhere but remained unsigned for months. The Oilers later offered a one-year contract. Roslovic now aims to impress this season to secure a better deal next summer. This situation highlights the unpredictable nature of NHL contracts.

title: IPS officer 'suicide' case: Another Haryana cop shoots self; records final video
content: A Haryana police officer, Sandeep Lather, allegedly committed suicide, accusing Inspector General Y Puran Kumar of corruption in a video. Lather's death follows Kumar's own alleged suicide, where he named several officers. The incident has led to internal investigations and administrative changes within the Haryana police department.

title: 'Pak casualties along LoC over 100': DGMO Lt Gen Rajiv Ghai on Operation Sindoor - watch
content: India's Director General Military Operations revealed Operation Sindoor, a precise military response to the Pahalgam terror attack, resulted in over 100 Pakistani casualties. This operation, a blend of military action and diplomatic strategy, also saw the Indus Water Treaty temporarily suspended. The successful termination of the three perpetrators after a 96-day pursuit highlights India's commitment to justice.

title: Rajasthan: Bus travelling from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur catches fire; casualties reported
content: A private bus traveling from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur caught fire near Thaiyat village, resulting in multiple casualties. The bus, which departed Jaisalmer around 3 pm, was engulfed in flames shortly after smoke was seen from its rear. Rescue operations are ongoing, and the injured have been rushed to Jawahir Hospital.

title: How fire crackers can damage baby lungs this festive season
content: Festivals in India bring joy with fireworks, but the smoke poses serious dangers to babies. Their developing lungs are highly vulnerable to pollutants like PM2.5 and heavy metals. Studies show a dramatic rise in air pollution during festivals, impacting infant health. Parents must take precautions to protect their little ones.

title: LG‚Äôs stellar listing: $13 bn giant more valuable than South Korean parent! Top 5 takeaways
content: LG Electronics India has achieved a remarkable stock market debut. The company's shares opened with a 50% premium, significantly exceeding its issue price. This strong performance has propelled its market valuation past its South Korean parent company.

title: Mahomes surprises Andrews with unexpected public message after Chiefs win
content: Brittany Mahomes garnered attention following the Kansas City Chiefs' victory by showcasing her support for Erin Andrews' fashion line, WEAR by Erin Andrews. She posted a photo of her outfit from the brand on Instagram, thanking Andrews directly. This gesture highlights the growing trend of NFL partners promoting women's sports apparel.

title: 'Historic low‚Äô: US drops out of top 10 most powerful passports list!
content: For the first time in two decades, the US passport has fallen out of the top 10 most powerful, now sharing 12th place with Malaysia. This decline, attributed to various access restrictions and an inward-looking policy, contrasts with China's significant gains in global mobility and influence.

title: Delhi-NCR pollution: GRAP stage-1 curbs imposed after air quality hits 'poor' category
content: The commission for air quality management has activated Stage-I of the graded response action plan in Delhi-NCR. This action follows a drop in the air quality index to the 'poor' category. Forecasts predict continued poor air quality. All implementing agencies will intensify measures to prevent further deterioration. Citizens are urged to follow the citizen charter.

title: 'Tough for Shubman Gill ... ': Gautam Gambhir opens up ahead of ODI series vs Australia
content: India head coach Gautam Gambhir lauded Shubman Gill, stating he has already passed his toughest captaincy test in England. Gambhir emphasised that Gill earned the dressing room's respect by "saying and doing the right things," highlighting his leadership during the recent Test series win.

title: EPFO extends settlement period: PF withdrawal after 12 months, what it means for you
content: The EPFO has extended the withdrawal period for provident fund and pension accounts for the unemployed. Members can now claim their provident fund after 12 months and pension after 36 months of joblessness. This move aims to boost social security and encourage long-term retirement savings by retaining a minimum balance.

title: Justin Trudeau ‚Äòpursued‚Äô Katy Perry since July; flew to California
content: Pop star Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's romance has reportedly been developing for months, with Trudeau actively pursuing Perry since their July meeting. Recent yacht photos off Santa Barbara captured the pair sharing affectionate moments, fueling widespread speculation about their relationship.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli's singing video goes viral; Anushka Sharma reacts
content: Virat Kohli is set to feature in India's upcoming three-match ODI series against Australia, commencing October 19. Arriving in Delhi, Kohli's preparation is marked by a viral video of him singing at his sangeet ceremony. The series will be played across Perth, Adelaide, and Sydney, with Kohli aiming to replicate his strong historical performance in Australian conditions.

title: Roger Federer vs Rafael Nadal net worth 2025: Federer leads with $1.1 billion fortune
content: Tennis titans Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal continue to command massive earnings post-retirement. Federer, with a net worth of $1.1 billion, boasts lucrative endorsements and a stake in On Running. Nadal, valued at $220 million, excels on court and runs his own academy. Their enduring legacies and potential exhibition matches captivate fans globally.

title: Madagascar unrest: Military takes power after president's impeachment
content: Madagascar's military has seized control of the Indian Ocean nation following President Andry Rajoelina's impeachment and reported flight. A colonel announced the formation of a governing council, with a prime minister to be appointed for a civilian government. This comes after an elite military unit joined anti-government protests fueled by shortages and corruption.

title: From Macron to Meloni: 5 world leaders who got the 'Trump treatment' at Gaza summit
content: World leaders convened in Egypt for a Gaza Peace Summit following a Trump-brokered ceasefire. While the summit focused on rebuilding Gaza and monitoring the truce, President Trump's theatrical interactions with leaders, including praise for Meloni, an awkward moment with Starmer, effusive flattery from Sharif, a tense handshake with Macron, and a hot mic exchange with Subianto, captured significant attention.

title: Earth hits first climate tipping point as coral reefs face irreversible collapse
content: Earth has hit its first climate tipping point: warm water coral reefs face irreversible decline. Scientists warn that without immediate global heating reduction to 1.2¬∞C, these vital ecosystems, supporting millions, will collapse. Widespread bleaching and unprecedented stress are already pushing reefs beyond their limits, demanding urgent action to protect marine life and human livelihoods.

title: JD(U) says Bihar CM 'absolutely happy' with NDA seat-sharing; claims oppn 'spreading rumours'
content: JD(U) MP Sanjay Kumar Jha asserted that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is "absolutely happy" with the NDA's seat-sharing deal for the upcoming state assembly elections.  He accused the opposition of spreading rumors, stating that all five NDA parties are united and ready for the polls under Nitish Kumar's guidance.

title: India's GDP growth: IMF revises 2025 outlook upwards to 6.6%; 2026 dip seen on Trump tariffs
content: India's GDP growth forecast for 2025 has been boosted to 6.6% by the IMF, reflecting strong reform initiatives and digital advancements. Despite global economic moderation and tariff concerns, the nation's robust domestic fundamentals are expected to maintain its position as a key global growth engine, poised to become the world's third-largest economy.

title: India Post resumes postal services to US; launches duty-paid system
content: India is set to resume all international postal services to the US from October 15, 2025. A new Delivery Duty Paid (DDP) system will collect customs duties upfront in India, ensuring faster clearance and seamless delivery. This move follows US import rule changes and aims to boost exports by offering transparent and affordable shipping.

title: Ahmedabad airport on high alert: Qatar Airways flight reports cabin pressure issue
content: A Qatar Airways flight from Doha to Hong Kong declared a full emergency over Indian airspace due to a sudden loss of cabin pressure. The Boeing 777, flight QR 816, made a safe emergency landing at Ahmedabad Airport. All passengers and crew were unharmed, and airport operations resumed shortly after.

title: ‚ÄòThis was scary‚Äô: Travis Kelce‚Äôs head-first fall vs Lions sparks concussion fears
content: Travis Kelce's scary head-first fall during the Chiefs' 30-17 win over the Lions sparked fan concern, with many questioning the lack of immediate concussion evaluation. Despite the alarming incident, Kelce played on, later focusing on the team's tough victory rather than his own safety.

title: Trump‚Äôs peace deal makes Time cover ‚Äî but he‚Äôs at war with his photo
content: Donald Trump expressed strong disapproval of Time Magazine's cover photo, calling it the "worst photo of All Time" for a story celebrating his role in mediating the release of Israeli hostages.  He criticized the image for distorting his appearance and questioned the magazine's motives behind selecting such an unflattering portrayal of his supposed triumph in brokering a Gaza ceasefire deal.

title: 'I need one ... ': Rare instance of Gambhir cracking joke at India press conference
content: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir lightened up after a recent match. He humorously suggested he needs a mental conditioning coach given India's busy schedule. Gambhir also spoke about the team's batting and spin bowling. He highlighted the importance of adapting to different pitches. The upcoming series will test India's home strength.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do at midseason
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the playoff picture takes shape.

title: UConn ranked No. 1 in women's preseason poll
content: Defending champion UConn picked up where it left off as the No. 1 team in the country in the Associated Press Top 25 preseason women's basketball poll.

title: Ravens release veteran CJGJ 1 week after signing
content: The Ravens are releasing veteran safety C.J. Gardner-Johnson a week after signing him to their practice squad. He did not appear in a game for the team.

title: Bears' Moody caps whirlwind day with walk-off FG
content: Jake Moody was elevated from the practice squad just seven hours before nailing a 38-yard field goal as time expired to beat the Commanders 25-24 on Monday night.

title: Larsen-like Snell silences Brewers in Game 1 win
content: Blake Snell led the Dodgers to a 2-1 Game 1 victory in the NLCS against the Brewers, pitching his way into the kind of company he knew he'd be keeping when he signed with L.A. before the season.

title: Brewers turn MLB's 1st playoff 8-6-2 double play
content: The Brewers pulled off the first 8-6-2 double play in MLB postseason history against the Dodgers in Game 1 of the NLCS on Monday night.

title: Serrano to defend featherweight titles vs. Cruz
content: Women's featherweight champion Amanda Serrano will defend her WBO and WBA titles against Erika Cruz in front of her hometown fans at Coliseo Roberto Clemente in San Juan, Puerto Rico, on Jan. 3, 2026, ESPN confirmed on Tuesday.

title: Titans fire Callahan, to give McCoy shot at job
content: The Titans have fired Brian Callahan just six games into his second season as the team's head coach. He finishes with a 4-19 record as the team's coach.

title: Turang: Dodging would-be HBP 'natural reaction'
content: Milwaukee's Brice Turang was inches from wearing a game-tying hit by pitch in Game 1 of the NLCS on Monday night -- but reflex caused him to back away.

title: üèà Kiper's Big Board: Top 25 NFL draft prospects
content: Mel Kiper Jr. is stacking the top 25 players for the 2026 NFL draft, including four quarterbacks and one really good running back. See who makes the list.

title: NFL Week 7 Power Rankings: Our 1-32 poll, plus the biggest lessons learned so far for every team
content: We reshuffled the teams in our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 7. Plus, here are the biggest lessons for each roster so far this season.

title: Takeaways from Week 6: Robinson shines for Falcons, Moody kicks Bears to victory
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 6.

title: Judging the MLB playoffs: The team to beat, who has the vibes to stop them, and this October's top ace
content: We hand out verdicts on how real -- or not real -- the biggest storylines are of this postseason so far.

title: NHL Rank: From 1 to 100, who will be the best players in 2025-26?
content: Connor McDavid remains No. 1, but who lands after? Here's who the ESPN panel believes is best for this season.

title: 'Pretty darn impressive': Alex Ovechkin still wowing teammates amid uncertain future
content: After Ovi broke Wayne Gretzky's record, his teammates expect more of the same in the final year of his deal.

title: Warriors in the Finals? Lakers under .500?! We simulated the entire 2025-26 NBA season
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton used simulation No. 620 to run through the NBA season from Opening Night to the Finals.

title: Opening night or late-season debuts? Key NBA superstar injury returns to watch for
content: From opening night to late season debuts, here are the biggest superstar injury returns to watch for in the 2025-26 NBA season.

title: Ranking every championship team: 2023 Aces are No. 1
content: Las Vegas' 2023 title team topped our rankings two years ago. Where do the 2025 Aces and 2024 Liberty fit in?

title: CBA negotiations: Everything to know with deadline looming
content: Here are the biggest issues and how players' criticisms of Cathy Engelbert might impact negotiations.

title: Passan: Jorge Polanco has the Mariners on the way to a Hollywood ending
content: Harry Potter, Iceman ... or George Bonds? Whatever you call him, Jorge Polanco has the Mariners rolling.

content: Could a procedural advantage be the difference in Houston finally winning a national title? Plus, the newest teams joining the field of 68.

title: AP preseason Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: The reigning champion UConn Huskies top the list. Find out where South Carolina, UCLA and the rest clock in.

title: First bets for Week 7: Buccaneers' luck runs out vs. Lions, Giants cover in Denver
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are five early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: How USMNT, USWNT choose opponents, venues and prices for games
content: USMNT and USWNT fans often complain about high ticket prices, repetitive cities and weak opponents for games, but U.S. Soccer explains everything that goes into such decisions.

title: The tiny island nation that's two wins from a World Cup spot
content: Meet the team of part-timers, ranked 150 by FIFA, hoping to reach next summer's tournament. "Every young boy wants to play in a World Cup, it is a dream... and we know we have a chance."

title: Buzz from MNF: London, Robinson shine on eventful night in fantasy
content: Many Week 6 fantasy outcomes were determined Monday night, with a pair of Falcons playing starring roles.

title: Pickups: Vidal steps up; Dart, Darnold being underrated
content: Highlighting free agent options after some big performances this weekend and to help with injury concerns.

title: Checking the temperature of the NFL's hottest seats: Barnwell on Mike McDaniel, Justin Fields
content: Should the Dolphins or Ravens make coaching changes? Is it time for a QB switch for the Jets? Might the Eagles consider moves in their secondary?

title: Divisional rankings: Jaron 'Boots' Ennis makes junior middleweight debut
content: Former unified welterweight champion scored a first-round TKO in his 154 pounds debut. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: The Vision is blurred
content: Seth Rollins was blindsided when The Vision teammates Bron Breakker and Bronson Reed betrayed him at 'Raw.'

title: Transfer rumors, news: Neymar eyeing shock return to Europe
content: Santos forward Neymar is open to a move to Serie A amid links to Inter Milan and Napoli. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: US Expects Support From India, Allies Against China's Rare Earth Curbs
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent revealed on Monday that Washington expects support from its allies and friends, including India, over its attempt to counter China's latest export controls on rare earths.

title: 19 Killed After Bus Catches Fire On Jaisalmer-Jodhpur Highway
content: Nineteen people were killed when a private bus travelling from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur in Rajasthan caught fire on Tuesday, the police said.

title: London Mosque Barring Women From Charity Run 'Unacceptable': Minister
content: UK Communities Secretary Steve Reed said Tuesday it was "absolutely unacceptable" for women to have been excluded from a charity running event in a London park organised by a mosque.

title: Jharkhand Student Dies After Being Slapped By School Principal For Wearing Slippers: Cops
content: A class 12 student, who was allegedly slapped by the principal in-charge of her school for coming to the institute wearing a slipper a month ago in Jharkhand's Garhwa district, died in a hospital on Tuesday, police said.

title: AIADMK MP's "Free Wife" Comment Sparks Outrage
content: AIADMK MP C Ve Shanmugam has triggered a political storm with his controversial comment targeting Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin.

title: All-Time Deliveries Of Airbus A320 Top Boeing 737 For 1st Time
content: The Airbus A320 has overtaken the Boeing 737, the US aviation giant's single-aisle legacy aircraft, in terms of all-time deliveries for the first time, according to figures released Tuesday.

title: Amid Ceasefire, Israeli Forces Killed 6 Palestinians: Gaza Civil Defence
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said Israeli forces killed six Palestinians in separate incidents Tuesday, while the military reported its troops had opened fire on suspects who approached their positions.

title: Zubeen Garg Death Probe: 2 Key Witnesses From Singapore Appear Before Assam CID
content: Two more Assamese expats, who were present at the yacht party in Singapore during the final moments of legendary singer Zubeen Garg on September 19, appeared before the Assam Police's Criminal Investigation Department (CID) on Tuesday.

title: India To Resume Postal Services To US After Nearly Two-Month Suspension
content: India will resume all postal services to the United States from Wednesday after putting in place systems to collect duties upfront, the Department of Posts said.

title: Reunited Hostage Describes Stark Differences In Couple's Gaza Captivity
content: Former Israeli hostage Noa Argamani spoke out after her partner was released under the Gaza ceasefire deal, to describe the differences in their treatment in captivity in the Palestinian territory.

title: Husbands, Wives Compete For Poll Tickets In Bihar. Men Lead 2-0
content: A race is on between husbands and wives in Bihar for tickets in the coming assembly election. No holds are barred in this race.

title: Durgapur Medical Student's Friend Arrested In Rape Case, Total Now 6
content: The friend of the medical student who was raped near a private medical college in West Bengal's Durgapur has been arrested by the police, taking the total arrests in the case to six.

title: Pakistan Lost Over 100 Soldiers During Operation Sindoor: Top Officer
content: Pakistan is understood to have lost over 100 military personnel along the Line of Control during Operation Sindoor, Indian Army's Director General Military Operations Lt Gen Rajiv Ghai said on Tuesday.

title: "Any Inclusion In Alliance Will Be Decided...": Congress On Raj Thackeray Buzz
content: Buzz about the possible inclusion of the Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) has been circulating in Maharashtra's political circles, but the Congress party insists that no formal proposal or discussion.

title: Sharjeel Imam To Seek Interim Bail From Top Court To Contest Bihar Polls
content: Sharjeel Imam, an accused in the 2020 Delhi riots case, withdrew his plea before a court seeking a 14-day interim bail to file his nomination and campaign for the upcoming Bihar Assembly elections.

title: Israel To Halve Gaza Aid Over Slow Return Of Dead Hostages
content: The fragile ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war was tested as the slower-than-hoped return of dead hostages from Gaza prompted an Israeli military agency to declare a "violation" of the truce agreement.

title: "It Could Have Been Catastrophic For Pak": Top Officer On Operation Sindoor
content: The Indian Navy had sailed into the Arabian Sea and was ready for action when Pakistan reached out and called for a cessation of hostilities after four days of military conflict in May that had alarmed the world, said DGMO Lt Gen Rajiv Ghai.

title: Clans, Armed Groups In Gaza Posed Challenge To Hamas As War Went On
content: As the Gaza war dragged on, a diminished Hamas faced growing internal challenges to its control of Gaza from long-standing rivals, many of them affiliated with powerful local clans.

title: Women's Panel For Action Within 3 Days On Sexual Assault At Delhi's South Asian University
content: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has taken suo motu cognisance of the alleged sexual assault of a woman student inside the South Asian University (SAU) campus in Delhi.

title: Missing Bodies Of Hostages Top List Of Uncertainties Amid Fragile Gaza Peace
content: The tenuous ceasefire in the two-year Israel-Hamas war was holding even as complex issues remained ahead, a day after widespread jubilation over the return to Israel of the last 20 living hostages held in Gaza.

title: Over 100 Pakistani casualties as a result of India‚Äôs decisive response to Pahalgam attack: Lt. Gen. Rajiv Ghai
content: Director General of Military Operations says Pakistan‚Äôs posthumous gallantry medals proves high number of casualties; says India achieved its political and military goals through targeted operations

title: Defence Minister calls for reformed multilateralism, upholding rules-based global order
content: Peacekeepers today face increasingly complex challenges, from volatile environments marked by terrorism to humanitarian crises, Rajnath Singh said at the Chiefs‚Äô Conclave of the United Nations Troop Contributing Countries, being hosted by India for the first time

content: For the second time in six months, the top court questions ED‚Äôs conduct in the case; ‚Äúwhat happens to the federal structure,‚Äù asks CJI Gavai

title: Confusion continues in Mahagatbandhan¬†
content: With no decision on the seat division between the allies, each party is busy clearing the names of its candidates to ensure that they do not miss the nomination deadline¬†

content: He condemns the Kerala government and Save Kerala Brigade for filing a petition seeking permission to demolish the dam

content: He alleges that the ‚Äògrowing spread of narcotic drugs‚Äô is the major reason for the rise in such criminal activities

title: Rekha Gupta, BJP‚Äôs only woman CM, to campaign extensively for Bihar Assembly election
content: The outcome of the Bihar election will depend heavily on voting by women, and Gupta is a good orator who connects with the audience through her straight talk, a party leader said

title: India to train border security force of Mongolia: PM Modi
content: The PM highlights common Buddhist bonds between Mongolia and India and says India will start issuing free e-visas for Mongolian citizens

title: CMC launches specialised team for patients affected with blood clot
content: According to a press release, the team was started to mark World Thrombosis Day, observed annually on October 13, and a global awareness campaign initiated by the International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis (ISTH) in 2014.

title: 61 Maoists, including top leader Bhupati, surrender in Maharashtra
content: A senior official said that with Bhupati‚Äôs surrender, ‚Äúthe core family of the Naxal movement‚Äù has ended and that it is a ‚Äúmajor step in the elimination‚Äù of the insurgency

content: Consignment of 537 cartons of Indian-made foreign liquor was being transported from Punjab in a truck with fake registration plates

content: At the same time, the court has said it will be crucial to ensure that the victim is not made a party in any proceedings or applications. When the victim‚Äôs family or¬†de facto¬†complainant are impleaded, their identity and details should be protected

title: Discontent grows in JD(U) over ticket distribution, seat-sharing
content: JD(U) MP Ajay Kumar Mandal offers to resign while MLA Gopal Mandal sits in protest, both claiming that they are not allowed to meet Chief Minister Nitish Kumar; three leaders file nomination even before party releases candidate list; however, party working president Sanjay Jha says ‚Äòall is well‚Äô within the NDA.

title: Focus on enterprises that can generate employment,  Kudumbashree women told
content: Minister for Local Self-government inaugurates Kerala Women‚Äôs Commission face-to-face programme on new opportunities for Kudumbashree women

title: Ten feared dead as sleeper bus catches fire near Jaisalmer
content: Sixteen others injured in the blaze; Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma rushes to the spot, cause of fire under investigation

title: Almost 60% of India‚Äôs elephants are in Karnataka, Assam, Tamil Nadu
content: The Wildlife Institute of India released the first-ever DNA-based synchronous estimation of elephants across the country

title: Supreme Court asks States to appoint nodal officers to trace missing children, upload details on Centre-run portal
content: The top court noted that despite the existence of a dedicated portal, there was hardly any dissemination of information among the stakeholders

title: Murmurs of dissent bedevil Youth Congress‚Äôs new leadership
content: Abin Varkey who was widely reckoned to become YC State chief requests YC national leadership to relieve him of his national duties as he prefers to work in the State

title: Centre rejects mining proposal in Tumakaru reserve forests
content: The regional office of the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEF&CC), Bengaluru, has rejected a proposal for diversion of 48.2 ha of forestland for a mining project in Tumakuru district

title: Andhra Pradesh launches landmark initiative to conserve 16 key wetlands: Pawan Kalyan
content: The initiative aims to protect vital wetlands, promote eco-tourism, safeguard rare species, and secure international recognition, showcasing Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs commitment to environmental conservation, he says

title: Nirmala Sitharaman says enabling environment for R&D, start-ups helped in retaining talent pool
content: The Union Finance Minister has said that such a space has been created after the transformation in the digital landscape in the last eight years

title: Central government staff protest over ‚Äòinaction‚Äô on workplace harassment allegations in Social Justice Ministry
content: CSS officers hold peace march and sit-in at Shastri Bhawan weeks after a Ministry official tried to kill himself ‚Äôs suicide attempt over alleged harassment.

title: Modi‚Äôs diplomacy a disaster, says Congress after Trump praises Pakistan Army chief
content: Party says U.S. President ‚Äòendorsing India‚Äôs enemies‚Äô on global stage despite Modi‚Äôs claims of close friendship with Trump; it seeks answers from PM on why govt. failed to isolate Pak. internationally

title: Law Ministry unveils ‚ÄúLive Cases‚Äù dashboard to track government litigation in real time
content: The new feature under the Legal Information Management and Briefing System aims to improve transparency and coordination across Ministries, says Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal

title: Naidu trying to divert attention from fake liquor mafia, alleges Sajjala
content: YSRCP State coordinator calls for party unity and strong grassroots action to expose TDP‚Äôs alleged corruption

title: Legal action sought against Kada Siddeshwara Swami
content: Jagatika Lingayat Mahasabha strongly condemns his remarks against community seers and followers of social reformer Basaveshwara

title: Sharjeel Imam withdraws plea seeking bail to contest Bihar election
content: His advocate said that a regular bail plea was pending before the Supreme Court, and so the top court would be the ‚Äòproper‚Äô forum to file the plea for interim relief as well

title: Kerala Waqf Board may seek legal remedy to expunge adverse comments in HC order
content: Board is facing the unique challenge of restoring its ‚Äúorganisational esteem‚Äù and legal relevance and defending its decision in the Munambam case in the wake of Division Bench of  Kerala High Court castigating it as a land grabber while declaring the holding as not a Waqf property

title: Taxpayers Association demands expedition of construction of second flyover in Ajith Singh Nagar
content: Thousands of labourers from Vambay Colony, Payakapuram, Ajith Singh Nagar, Rajarajeswari Peta commute everyday to the main city in search of work and this has lead to traffic congestions on the flyover, says association

title: State govt. librarian found dead in Malkhed after being depressed over unpaid salary
content: Her bereaved family members hold department officials responsible for her death and demand compensation and employment

title: Will not allow even an inch of Waqf land to be encroached, says A.P. Waqf Board Chairman
content: Chief Minister Nara Chandrababu Naidu has given me the responsibility to protect Waqf properties and under my chairmanship, encroachers, blackmailers, and miscreant realtors will have a tough time, says Abdul Aziz

title: Qatar Airways flight makes emergency landing in Ahmedabad¬†
content: Technical inspections are underway to determine whether the aircraft can continue its journey to Hong Kong; if not, Qatar Airways will deploy an alternate aircraft to minimise delay for passengers, sources said.

title: Get advertisements pre-certified, EC tells parties ahead of Bihar polls
content: The poll panel told candidates to inform it about their authentic social media accounts; it said that monitoring committees will pre-certify advertisements of all political parties

title: Leaders welcome Google‚Äôs ‚Çπ87,520-crore AI hub in Visakhapatnam as boost to India‚Äôs digital growth
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlights the project as a major step toward building a developed India, democratising technology, and advancing AI innovation

title: Telangana phone tapping case: Supreme Court asks ex-official to share iCloud password
content: The top court was hearing the State‚Äôs application to vacate its order granting former Telangana Special Intelligence Bureau chief Prabhakar Rao interim protection from arrest

title: With 26,054 buses in State including 7,067 in city, Bengaluru and Karnataka lead in India‚Äôs public transport
content: While the national average stands at 1.2 buses per 1,000 people, Karnataka provides 3.81 buses per 1,000 people, according to Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy.

title: Collector calls for united push to boost tourism in Chittoor
content: Says concerted efforts by the Tourism, Forest, and Endowments Departments is crucial to unlocking the district‚Äôs tourism potential and drawing more visitors

title: Supreme Court seeks Centre, SEBI response on Sahara‚Äôs plea to sell 88 properties to Adani Group
content: Adani Properties said that it was prepared to acquire all 88 properties in a single transaction, even if certain assets were under dispute, to avert prolonged litigation

title: Hyderabad Traffic Police begin crackdown on motorists using phone while driving
content: As per data, between January 1 and October 12 this year, the police booked 80,555 cases for phone use while driving, including 2,345 cases during a drive held on October 13 and 14

title: Ashley Tellis, Mumbai-born US thinktanker under Justice Department lens for China links
content: a federal court has issued a search warrant for Tellis's home in Vienna . a raid by the FBI had located thousands of pages of classified documents in the house . the development shocked the city‚Äôs think=tank community given the respect Tellis commanded for his work in the US-India-China domain as a scholar .

title: The race to the 2026 World Cup: South Africa book place, and four more will lock today
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're still a long way from discovering the full list of 45 nations that will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the field of 48 . the final two rounds of the group stage take place in October, when we will discover the seven nations joining Morocco and Tunisia .

title: NBA big-three tiers: Ranking core trios for all 30 teams
content: Iman Shumpert is looking forward to seeing how the Thunder respond after winning the title . looking at the top three players on each roster is a good way to measure the short- and long-term health of an organization . we have laid out the cores of all 30 NBA teams .
